data.title: Lifesaving Society Alberta and Northwest Territories Branch
data.meta_description: The Lifesaving Society is a national, independent, charitable organization that works to prevent drowning and water-related injury through its training programs, Water Smart® public education, aquatic safety management services, drowning research and lifesaving sport.
data.text:
New Water Smart® Advocate Course

Become a Water Smart® Advocate with our new FREE online course! Dive into this course to unlock essential skills and knowledge to keep you and your loved ones safe in, on, and around water and ice. Elevate your water safety awareness and injury prevention practices today — because safety is our priority, and it should be yours too.

Available Now on Our Online Academy!

Introducing the Alberta Safe Beach Drowning Reduction Project

Have you seen our new water safety signs or picked up our public education materials while enjoying Alberta’s Provincial Parks? Fill out our survey for a chance to win a free lifejacket!

Learn More!

Water Smart Education

Increase awareness of the public to the risks associated with activities in, on and around water and ice and to modify at-risk behaviours to eliminate drowning and water-related injury.

Learn More »

Member Services

Who are our members? If you have a Member ID (like you find on a certification card), then you're a member. If that's you - hooray! This section is committed to serving you!

Learn More »
